title: Campaign to create traffic rule awareness launched
text:
Tribune News Service
Shimla, October 21
DGP Sanjay Kumar today opened a statewide road safety club and launched a traffic education awareness campaign in all districts. He directed officials to take steps to improve functioning of police stations and maintain cleanliness there. Addressing a gathering on National Police Commemoration Day today, the DGP highlighted the sacrifices made by police personnel and paramilitary forces while fighting terrorists and anti-social elements. He said children, students, women, mahila mandals and other sections of society would visit the police stations under the community policing scheme ‘Vishwas Yojana’. Sanjay Kumar recalled how a contingent of the CRPF was ambushed by the Chinese Army. Ten officers were killed on the fateful day, he said. They are remembered throughout the country on Police Commemoration Day for their exemplary courage, he said. The police have also chalked out special programmes for Police Welfare Week to be celebrated from today. Meetings to review the functioning of police clubs, seminars, debates, declamations and lectures will also be organised at each range headquarters and PTC, Daroh, focusing on human rights, police behaviour and code of conduct for the officers. SPs, Commandants and SDPOs will organise career counselling for the wards of police personnel. A workshop on ‘Police Media Interface’ will be held at the district level, inviting all sections of society along with senior police officers, intellectuals, government officers, judicial officers and mediapersons. Schoolchildren joined the police on the commemoration day parade at Bharari Ground.
